Utterance: Hi there! Welcome back. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing well. I’ve been focusing on staying positive and connecting with my co-workers.
That’s fantastic! Have you been able to build any new friendships at work?
Yes! I went out for coffee with a couple of them last week, and it was really nice.
That sounds like a great experience. How did it feel to connect with them outside of work?
It felt good! It was nice to talk about things other than work and just get to know them better.
Building those connections can be very rewarding. Have you noticed any changes in your mood after these interactions?
Definitely! I feel more energized and less lonely. It’s nice to have that support.
That’s wonderful to hear. You mentioned wanting to maintain your positivity. What strategies have you been using?
I’ve been trying to focus on gratitude. I write down a few things I’m thankful for each day.
Gratitude journaling can be a powerful practice. How has that impacted your outlook?
It really shifts my focus. Even on tough days, I can find something positive to hold onto.
That’s a great realization. Have you encountered any challenges while practicing gratitude?
Sometimes, it’s hard to think of things when I’m feeling down. I can get stuck in negative thoughts.
That’s understandable. It can be difficult to shift our mindset. Would you like to explore some techniques to help with that?
Yes, I’d love that! I want to get better at recognizing those moments.
One technique could be to challenge negative thoughts. When you notice them, ask yourself if they’re really true.
That makes sense. I often blow things out of proportion when I’m feeling low.
Exactly! It’s about finding balance in your thoughts. Have you tried any other coping strategies when you feel down?
I’ve been going for walks more often. It helps clear my head.
That’s a great strategy! Physical activity can be very beneficial for mental health. How do you feel after your walks?
I feel refreshed and more positive. It’s like a reset for me.
That’s wonderful! It seems like you’re developing a toolkit of strategies to manage your emotions.
I hope so! I want to keep building on that.
It sounds like you’re making good progress. Is there anything specific you’d like to focus on today?
I want to work on dealing with those negative thoughts when they come up.
Great goal! We can practice some cognitive restructuring techniques. Would you like to try that?
Yes, I’d really like that.
Okay, let’s start by identifying a recent negative thought you experienced.
I remember thinking I’m not good enough for this job when I made a mistake last week.
That’s a common thought. Let’s challenge it. What evidence do you have that supports or contradicts that thought?
Well, I’ve been doing well overall, and my supervisor said I’m improving.
That’s excellent evidence against the negative thought! How can you reframe that thought?
I guess I could say that everyone makes mistakes, and I’m learning and improving.
Exactly! That’s a much healthier perspective. How does that feel to acknowledge?
It feels good! I can see that I’m not defined by my mistakes.
That’s a powerful realization. Keep practicing that reframing technique when negative thoughts arise.
I will! I think it will help me a lot.
Is there anything else you’d like to cover today?
No, I think we’ve covered a lot! I feel really good about this session.
I’m glad to hear that! Thank you for your openness today. I look forward to our next session.
Me too! Thank you, Ellie.
Goodbye for now!
Bye!
